page.title: 01Greeny And The Hillside
page.content: An area of low, rounded hills with water lying in all depressions. This block is entirely rural, with a high percentage of hill land. There are several farms, keeping mainly beef cattle (wintered indoors) and sheep. Some cereals, root vegetables and fodder crops are grown. Incomes are augmented by B & B and machine- knitting. Some people commute to work in Kirkwall. The nearest shops are in Dounby, to the south. Hundland Loch has good sport fishing, mainly trout. The old house of Kirbister, between the lochs, is the best preserved of the old style of Orkney house with open central hearth. Most such houses were altered in the 19th century. Once a private museum, the old house of Kirbister now belongs to the islands council. Durkadale and north-east Greeny Hill are an RSPB
